</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 601 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Luck and good fortune bless the wielder of this _+3 greater striking [shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43)_. _Luck blades_ are crafted in a variety of styles, but their hilts or blades always incorporate symbols of luck, such as clovers, horseshoes, fish, ladybugs, or other symbols.

<document level="2" id="action-216" />

**Craft Requirements** Supply a casting of _wish_

</column>

<title
level="2"

pfs="Standard"
>
Luck Blade (Wishing)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 601 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 30,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Some _luck blades_ contain one [_wish_](/Spells.aspx?ID=377) when crafted. You can cast this spell as an arcane innate spell while wielding the _luck blade_, expending the spell. A spellcaster who can cast _wish_ can place another _wish_ into the blade by spending 8,000 gp and 4 days of downtime. A _wishing luck blade_ can hold no more than one _wish_ at a time.
